stem: Select the correct personal protective equipment (PPE) for a client with suspected active Pulmonary Tuberculosis (TB).
template: A client with active TB requires Airborne precautions. The nurse MUST wear a(n) {{ppe1}}, and the client must wear a(n) {{ppe2}} during transport to another department.

pedagogy.nclexCategory: Safety and Infection Prevention and Control

rationale.correct: Airborne = N95 (Heavily filtered). Clients don't wear N95s (too difficult to breathe); they wear a simple surgical mask to catch droplets at the source during transport.
rationale.incorrect: Surgical masks do NOT protect the nurse from airborne nuclei. N95s are never put on clients in clinical practice (valves/seal issues).
clinicalPearls: TB rooms must have Negative Pressure (exhausting to outside).

questionTrap.howToOvercome: N95 for Nurse; Surgical for Suzie (the patient).

answerBreakdown.label: Blank 1
